page.title: 15Traffic/Travel in Wolsingham
page.content: The main road through{Wolsingham comes from Durham and goes west toward the Lake District.In Wolsingham the road to Tow Law joins the A68,a main route to Scotland. {Traffic}through the town is heavy on summer weekends;the road has been improved to carry{Blue Circle Cement lorries.A{traffic survey}during the week showed that most cars were of {local registration. { Transport}is essential for getting to school,work and shops.90% of pupils at the Comprehensive school arrive by special bus.{Bus services are {infrequent. A survey showed that for every one person going to work by bus,seven walked and 20 went by car.The survey revealed that 1/6 of those asked frequently used the bus, 1/10 used it occasionally and 1/5 rarely.
